topic.question: 1. The student went to the right room. Which room did he go to?
2. Donald brought his son a dog. What did Donald do?
option: He took his child to the store.
He gave a game to his child.
He gave an animal to his child
He gave lessons to his child.

topic.question: 3. The men are going to construct a house. What would they use?
4. Bob and Bill are getting together for lunch. What will Bob do?
5. Mary asked Joe if he had a nice trip. Joe answered, "Yes."
option: He is going on a trip.

topic.question: 6. The instructor placed the book on the table.
7. Please pass the salt.
8. Sam is the same size as Henry.
9. Susan was packing her baggage.
option: Susan was going on a trip.
Susan was going to the movies.
Susan was going to the office.
Susan was going for a walk.

topic.question: 10. Most accidents take place in heavy traffic.
option: Accidents occur when there are many cars.
Accidents are cut down during the night.
Accidents increase when the lights are red.

topic.question: 11. Is this your favorite?
12. Sergeant White was driving his brand new car. He heard a loud noise. He stopped to see what it was. When did he hear a noise?
13. One of the students bought a portable typewriter. What kind did he get?
option: a typewriter which is light and easy to move
a type writer that cannot be moved

topic.question: 14. What do you usually do for recreation?
15. Tom arrived at the airport at six. The plane took off at seven. When did Tom arrive at the airport?
option: too late to see the plane take off
seven hours before the plane took off
an hour before the plane took off

topic.question: 16. We contacted our friends. What did we do?
17. Ms. Brown sits beside me in the class. Where does she sit?
18. Joe will be gone for an extended period of time. How long will he be gone?
option: for a short period of time
for a long period of time

topic.question: 19. Did you bother Mr. James when you called?
20. Where is the basement of a building?
option: between the first and second floors

topic.question: 21. Sarah was pleased with the acceleration of the car. What was she pleased with?
22. There was no wind on top of the mountain.
option: We reached the top by three o'clock.

topic.question: 23. The man will cooperate with the police.
option: The men will help the police.
The men will ignore the police.
The men will attack the police.
The men will confuse the police

topic.question: 24. Our team was composed of three people.
option: Our team saw the three people
Our team talked to the three people.
The three people defeated our team.
The three people made up our team.

topic.question: 25. Jack has a marvelous memory.
26. I ran into Mr. Noland yesterday in a bookstore.
option: I did not see Mr. Nolan yesterday.
My car hit Mr. Nolan's car yesterday.

topic.question: 27. Harry rejected my offer.
28. Sgt Brown said, "May I leave for town at eight?" The instructor said, "Yes."
option: Sgt Brown can leave at eight.
The instructor will not let him go.
Sgt Brown doesn't want to go.

topic.question: 29. Mr. Smith said, "Look at this column in the newspaper." What does he want you to look at?
30. The book has many chapters. What is a chapter?
31. What is the opposite of a tailwind?
32. Lt. Adams was concerned about the health of his men. How did he feel about their health?
33. Walter has a good deal of cash on hand. What does he have?
34. The mechanic turned off the ignition switch because the battery was dead. What did the mechanic do?
35. The children cook their own supper tonight. I didn't help them.
option: Supper was prepared by my wife.
My wife and I prepared the supper.
The children can't cook at all.
The children did all the work.

topic.question: 36. Bill doesn't have a car and neither does Jim.
option: Jim does not have a car.

topic.question: 37 . This blue suit is more expensive than the gray one.
option: The cost of the suits is the same.

topic.question: 38. Irene wants to know the literal meaning of the word.
option: She wants to know the slang for the word.
She wants to know the special expression.
She wants to know the opposite meaning of it.
She wants to know the exact meaning of it.

topic.question: 39. Since the time of World war One, incredible progress has been made in the development and production of this weapon.
option: No progress has been made since World War I.

topic.question: 40. The sergeant told the troops to see him before they took off.
option: The sergeant told the men to leave now.
The sergeant wanted to see the troops before their departure.
The sergeant told the troops to change their uniforms.
The sergeant told the group to report for drill.

topic.question: 41. Drop around after class the instructor will help you with the problem.
option: You must wait for the instructor.
The instructor can't help you after class.
The instructor wants to see you in class.

topic.question: 42. He put the money in a slot. Where did he put it?
43. Darlene made a decision.
44. While we were discussing the matter, Alice suddenly cut in. What did she do?
45. The major briefed the students the day they arrived.
46. The weather report said we should expect hail. What should we expect?
47 . The doctor wants to check John's pulse. What does the doctor want to check?
48. People can sell things by placing description of what they want to sell in the newspaper. Where are these prescriptions found in the paper?
49. It sounds like Jack enjoyed himself at the party.
option: Jack enjoyed the sound at the party.
Jack didn't like the sounds at the party.
It seems that Jack had a good time.
Jack himself didn't like the party.

topic.question: 50. Before shooting at the target, Delores computed the range.
option: She knew the range and hit the target.
She figured out the distance to the target.
She talked to the ranger before shooting at the target.
She shot and hit the target from a great distance.

topic.question: 51. Harold approached the woman.
52. The students like their teacher because he sticks to the subject matter.
option: The teacher talks about everything in the class.
The teacher follows the lesson plan very closely.
The teacher answers all types of general questions.
The teacher holds his book firmly in both hands.

topic.question: 53. Barbara enjoyed his act very much. What did she like?
54. Joe went to the sporting goods store to buy a fishing rod.
55. Wearing gym shorts in a restaurant is not acceptable.
option: You shouldn't wear them in a restaurant.
They are allowed in a restaurant.
You shouldn't change them in a restaurant.
They are worn in a restaurant.

topic.question: 56. It began to drizzle soon after we landed.

57. M: What are you doing?
W: Taking a break.
Q: What does the woman say she is doing?

58. M: I heard about your accident. I am glad you weren't injured. Is your car okay too?
W: No, it was damaged.
Q: What happened to the car?

59. W: Why are you so sad?
M: Everywhere I go, people laugh at me.
Q: Where do people laugh at the man?
option: in a few places he goes
in none of the places he goes

topic.question:
60. W: He looks better today, doctor.
M: Good. But how's his appetite?
Q: What does the doctor want to know?
option: if the patient is seeing all right
if the patient is eating all right
if the patient is breathing all right
if the patient is talking all right

topic.question:
61. M: I will meet you at ten. Where?
W: I have to go to the drugstore. Meet me there.
Q: What does the woman have to do?

62. W: How did Rick do on the job?
M: His work is poor.
Q: What do you know about Rick?
option: He did different kinds of work.
He did not have much money.
He did well on his work.

topic.question:
63. W: What's the matter?
M: I'm in a rush.
Q: What do we know about the man?
option: He wants to go to bed.
He wants to get cleaned up.
He wants to drink something cold.
He did well on his work.

topic.question:
64. W: How did you find out about the news?
M: It was broadcast.
Q: How did the man find out about the news?
option: He listened to it on the radio.
He learned about it from a friend.
He read about it in a newspaper.
His brother told him about it.

topic.question:
65. M: What's Peter's house like?
W: It's huge.
Q: What did she say about the house?

66. M: What did you think of the book?
W: The ending is very abrupt.
Q: What did the woman think?
option: She thought the ending was good.
She thought the ending was obvious.
She thought the ending was sudden.
She thought the ending was sad.
